item.title: Frank add a quote by Vince Lombardi
item.description: "Success is never final. Failure is never fatal. It s courage that counts." -- Vince Lombardi

item.title: Frank add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Frank add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Frank add a quote by Philip James Bailey
item.description: "We should count time by heart-throbs. He most lives, Who thinks most, feels noblest, acts the best." -- Philip James Bailey

item.title: Frank add a quote by Kingsley Amis
item.description: "Consciousness was upon him before he could get out of the way." -- Kingsley Amis

item.title: Frank add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes

item.title: Frank add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "All that glisters is not gold; Often have you heard that told: Many a man his life hath sold But my outside to behold: Gilded tombs do worms enfold." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Frank add a quote by Robert J. Sawyer
item.description: "Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace." -- Robert J. Sawyer

item.title: Frank add a quote by Christopher Morley
item.description: "There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love." -- Christopher Morley

item.title: Frank add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "My doctor told me to stop having intimate dinners for four. Unless there are three other people." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Frank add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "I'm not young enough to know everything." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Frank add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "There is no place like home." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Frank add a quote by Peter Shaffer
item.description: "The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you." -- Peter Shaffer

item.title: Frank add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Frank add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Frank add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Frank add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Frank add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "The most exhausting thing in life, I have discovered, is being insincere." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Frank add a quote by Jean de La Fontaine
item.description: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." -- Jean de La Fontaine

item.title: Frank add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook

item.title: Frank add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Frank add a quote by Irving Stone
item.description: "There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books." -- Irving Stone

item.title: Frank add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Frank add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Frank add a quote by Arthur Cleveland Coxe
item.description: "Tis the night—the night Of the grave's delight, And the warlocks are at their play; Ye think that without, The wild winds shout, But no, it is they—it is they!" -- Arthur Cleveland Coxe

item.title: Frank add a quote by Isaac Newton
item.description: "If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants." -- Isaac Newton

item.title: Frank add a quote by Daniel Defoe
item.description: "It is never too late to be wise." -- Daniel Defoe

item.title: Frank add a quote by Herman Hesse
item.description: "Learn what is to be taken seriously and laugh at the rest." -- Herman Hesse

item.title: Frank add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Frank add a quote by Margaret Walker
item.description: "When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book." -- Margaret Walker
